citations.narrative:
At the start of the inspection, 10:51 am, the temperature inside the sheltered kennel building registered at 86.9 F. The
temperature was rechecked 4 hours (2:51pm), after the initial reading and was recorded at 89.1 F. Excessive heat is a
source of stress and discomfort to the enclosed dogs and can result in a variety of health impacts if not corrected. The
temperature in the interior portion of a sheltered kennel must not rise above 85F for more than four consecutive hours.
The licensee must ensure that interior temperatures are maintained at a safe level for the dogs.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
facility representative.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 15 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Conducting regulated activity without a valid USDA license is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.3(a)  Repeat
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
At the start of the inspection, 10:51 am, the temperature inside the sheltered kennel building registered at 86.9 F. The 
temperature was rechecked 4 hours (2:51pm), after the initial reading and was recorded at 89.1 F. Excessive heat is a 
source of stress and discomfort to the enclosed dogs and can result in a variety of health impacts if not corrected. The 
temperature in the interior portion of a sheltered kennel must not rise above 85F for more than four consecutive hours. 
The licensee must ensure that interior temperatures are maintained at a safe level for the dogs. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
facility representative. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 15 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Conducting regulated activity without a valid USDA license is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER 
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
